definition: ode/eulogy/to praise in writing/to wish (in letters)
to patronize/to support/to praise/(Internet slang) to like (an online post on Facebook etc)

sentences.english: One generation will commend your works to another; they will tell of your mighty acts.
sentences.chinese: 这代要对那代颂赞你的作为，也要传扬你的大能。

sentences.english: We could add others such as adoration and praise.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我们还可以加上敬拜和颂赞。

sentences.english: Prayer and praising all men raising, Worship Him, God on high.
sentences.chinese: 愿万人来祷告颂赞，朝拜真神在天。

sentences.english: So they sang praises with gladness and bowed their heads and worshiped.
sentences.chinese: 他们就欢欢喜喜地颂赞耶和华，低头敬拜。

sentences.english: Because your love is better than life, my lips will glorify you.
sentences.chinese: 因你的慈爱比生命更好，我的嘴唇要颂赞你。

sentences.english: Because thy lovingkindness is better than life, my lips shall praise thee.
sentences.chinese: 因你的慈爱比生命更好，我的嘴唇要颂赞你。

sentences.english: We should praise God for what reason?
sentences.chinese: 我们为什么应该颂赞上帝呢？

sentences.english: Let them give glory unto the LORD, and declare his praise in the islands.
sentences.chinese: 他们当将荣耀归给耶和华，在海岛中传扬他的颂赞。

sentences.english: But let's rest here and drink some water and admire the meadow.
sentences.chinese: 先让我们在这里喝点水稍事休息和颂赞这草甸。

sentences.english: Singing these songs that praise our great country, one feels stimulated .
sentences.chinese: 唱起这些颂赞伟大祖国的歌曲，使人心情振奋。

definition: a poem/a composition in verse/fig. epic (compared with historical epic)/the biblical Book of Psalms
God (in Catholicism)/abbr. for 天主教[Tian1 zhu3 jiao4], Catholicism
Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
